It is located in the borough of [[Le Sud-Ouest]] in [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]].[http://www.stm.info/English/metro/a-m43.htm Angrignon Metro Station] The station includes a large [[Bus terminus|terminal]] for [[bus]]es to southwest Montreal, the [[West Island]] ([[Dorval, Quebec|Dorval]]), and South Western Quebec as well as a [[Park and ride|parking lot]].{{cite web| url=http://www.amt.qc.ca/autobus_terminus_detail.aspx?terminusid=1| title= AMT page for Terminus Angrignon}} == Architecture == [[Image:Angrignon Metro Terminus.jpg|thumb|left|Station kiosk]] Angrignon Metro station is built with windows encasing the [[Rail tracks|tracks]] and [[side platform]]s, which creates a very light and airy environment. Jean-Louis Beaulieu received an award from the [[Ordre des architectes du QuÃ©bec]][http://www.oaq.com/fr/ordre/index.jsp Ordre des architectes du QuÃ©bec] for the design of the station. The station is equipped with the MÃ©troVision information screens which displays news, commercials, and the time till the next train. == Origin of the name == [[Jean-Baptiste Angrignon|Jean-Baptiste Arthur Angrignon]] was [[alderman]] of the district of [[Ville-Saint-Paul|Saint-Paul]] and a member of the Executive Committee of the city of Montreal. He oversaw the development of what is now [[Parc Angrignon]] on what was land that belonged to the Crawford family. The area was named after him in 1927. ==Terminus Angrignon== This large [[Bus station|bus terminal]] is a facility of the [[Agence mÃ©tropolitaine de transport]] (AMT). One area has bus bays assigned to suburban commuter buses from southwestern Quebec, with three bus loops being used by the STM for routes that service southwest Montreal and the [[West Island]].
